comment: Like all NEW YORK distiller bourbons I have tried so far, it lacks depth and in my opinion, is very young tasting and way over priced.  There is a strong alcohol smell initially on the nose which masks all other smells.  It taste like watered down corn syrup.  Long burn. Limited flavor profile.  May be better after aged a few more years
Thought it was Jack Daniels when I first smelled and tasted it. Definitely get the caramel and a leathery nose. Pretty good.
enjoying with @brent nice sweet taste. a little bit of cereals but overall the right amount of heat and sweet.

I get the basic cheap bourbon flavors from this. Cotton candy and bubble gum. This whisky is young and aggressive. The price does not reflect what you are getting. This is a $8-13 bottle. Not the $28 they are charging.
Flavor profile is very young, with intense alcohol on the nose. Would drink in a cocktail. Had at shot Donna's house.
Lots of alcohol smell and taste, very young tasting, and not much discernable flavor. Pass.
Very young with definite wood notes and alcohol on the nose. Not bad with ice. Short finish

Nose of alcohol fumes.

Zero burn. Taste of green tea.
